content.webTitle: Jaap Stam tests positive for nandrolone

fields.headline: Jaap Stam tests positive for nandrolone
fields.bodyText: Lazio's Dutch international defender Jaap Stam has tested positive for the banned steroid nandrolone, the Italian Olympic Committee (CONI) has confirmed. Stam, who is believed to have tested positive after Lazio's match against Atalanta on October 13, has been suspended immediately. Lazio spokeswoman Laura Zaccheo said the club would not make any immediate comment. "We haven't received anything official yet but we've heard the news," she said. Stam, who joined Lazio from United for £16.5m in August, becomes the second player at the Serie A club to fail such a test. Portuguese international Fernando Couto has just returned from a ban, while Juventus' Edgar Davids and Barcelona's Frank de Boer have also been suspended for use of the drug.
